description: September 14, 2020: With Bulletin N. 262, the Italian Ministry of Health announced that the Italian Minister of Health, Roberto Speranza, has attended the 70th session of the WHO Regional Committee for Europe (RC70), organised by the WHO Regional Office for Europe, on September 14 and 15, 2020. Representatives of 53 countries in the WHO European Region have attended. Representatives of WHO partners such as United Nations agencies and other intergovernmental organisations and regional networks, were also present. Non-State actors (NSAs) in official relations with WHO and regional NSAs accredited by the Regional Committee, have followed the webstream and had the opportunity to submit video and written statements in advance. The key health issues and future plans have been discussed, particularly on themes regarding the response to the COVID-19 pandemic and lessons learned from the pandemic, both globally and regionally.

description: The 15th of May, 2020, the Government of Andorra announced a decree regarding the partial reopening of school buildings (for public and private kindergarten, primary, secondary, high school and vocational schools from the 18th onwards. Also included are public and private higher education centers and the School of Training for Sports and Mountain Professions) with the aim that educational staff can access the facilities to collect material or use specific resources, as well as arrange face-to-face interviews. It is also expected that the centers that deem it appropriate may carry out certain face-to-face evaluation activities on a one-off basis. In no case does the text provide for the return of face-to-face teaching activity, which will continue to be carried out electronically. This partial reopening still demands the following of the prevention measures: mask mandate, 2m safety distance, 1/3 of total capacity, and 5 people maximum in interviews.

description: On April 16th, Andorra, has adopted a unique way of easing lockdown restrictions. Those who live in even-numbered homes are allowed to go out on even dates, while those who reside in odd-numbered homes on all other days. Houses without a number will go out on even dates if the name of occupants begins with A-M, and odd days if it starts with N-Z. Running or walking fast can take place between 6 am and 9 am or from 6 pm to 9 pm. Andorrans can shop or stroll between 9 am and 11 am or between 2 pm and 7 pm. The time between 11 am and 2 pm is reserved for vulnerable and elderly populations to get out of the house. UPDATE: The Government still requires people to stay at home but measures have been relaxed. People are allowed to go walking, running and to carry out sports activities in the mountains, such as hiking, running or fishing. They can choose between going out one hour every day or two hours on alternate days depending on the building numbers. Cycling as a means of transport is permitted.

description:
On March 20, 2020, the Minister of Health, Joan Martínez Benazet, announced that the Ministry of Health, in coordination with the Andorran Health Care Service (SAAS) and the Andorran Medical Association, has established a three-level system to care for patients who have developed coronavirus symptoms.

The first level encompasses patients with mild conditions, who will be treated and receive health instructions from their GP. Patients in the second level will receive treatment from the Intermediate Control Center (CIC), a new screening center adjacent to the Hospital Nostra Senyora de Meritxell. The CIC treats people with intermediate respiratory impairments. At the same time, it is able to collect PCR samples from the patient, without the patient coming out of their vehicle. The third level is for patients with more severe conditions, for those who have underlying conditions or who cannot travel to the CIC. Patients are cared for by 116 professionals either in Hospital Nostra Senyora de Meritxell or they would receive care while in home isolation.

The third level is for patients with more severe conditions, for those who have underlying conditions or who cannot travel to the CIC. Patients are cared for by 116 professionals either in Hospital Nostra Senyora de Meritxell or they would receive care while in home isolation.

description: The 15th of May, 2020, the Government of Andorra announced a decree regarding the partial reopening of school buildings (for public and private kindergarten, primary, secondary, high school and vocational schools from the 18th onwards.
